senses.de: A choice or decision between two or more possibilities
senses.ex: She had no alternative but to call the police.

Tips.title: No other choice
Tips.description: Used when there's only one possible action or solution left to take.
Tips.example: With the roads blocked, our alternative was to hike back.

Tips.title: Considering options
Tips.description: Highlights the process of choosing between different courses of action.
Tips.example: We considered several alternatives before making our decision.

senses.de: Different from something else and able to be used instead of it
senses.ex: The committee was instructed to explore alternative methods.

Tips.title: Plan B
Tips.description: Refers to a backup option in case the original plan fails.
Tips.example: If it rains, the alternative plan is to have the picnic indoors.

Tips.title: Substituting items
Tips.description: Indicates an item can replace another due to similarity or functionality.
Tips.example: Oat milk is a great alternative for those who are lactose intolerant.

senses.de: Music, fashion, or behavior that is different from the mainstream and often a reaction against it
senses.ex: Alternative rock has become very popular over the past few years.

Tips.title: Cultural uniqueness
Tips.description: Associated with trends or movements not found in mainstream culture.
Tips.example: She prefers alternative fashion styles, like vintage or bohemian.

Tips.title: Expressing individuality
Tips.description: Represents personal choice to deviate from what is common or traditional.
Tips.example: His taste in alternative music sets him apart at school.

senses.de: Denoting goods or services that are claimed to be more friendly to the environment
senses.ex: Alternative energy sources such as wind turbines and solar panels.

Tips.title: Eco-conscious choices
Tips.description: Signals environmental awareness and responsibility in choices.
Tips.example: She started using alternative cleaning products to reduce pollution.

Tips.title: Sustainability focus
Tips.description: Highlights an option's long-term benefits for the environment.
Tips.example: Using alternative energy is key to sustainable living.

Backup.wordDefinition:
Backup means a second copy or source of something that can be used if the original copy or source is lost or damaged.

For example, if you have important documents on your computer, you might create a backup copy on an external hard drive in case your computer crashes.

Alternative means a different option to choose from, while backup means a second copy or source to use as a safety net.

Choice.wordDefinition:
Choice refers to the selection of a preferred option from a range of options.

It is used when we have multiple options and need to select one. For example, when we go to a restaurant and are given a menu, we make a choice about what we would like to eat.

Choice is used to refer to the selection of preferred options from several, whereas alternative provides a different option in case a preferred one isn't possible or available.

Conventional.wordDefinition:
Alternative refers to a choice or method that is different from the mainstream or commonly accepted one. For example, alternative medicine refers to treatments that are not part of conventional Western medicine.

Conventional refers to the commonly accepted or traditional way of doing things. For example, conventional farming refers to the traditional methods of farming that use pesticides and fertilizers.

Traditional dresses and classic formulas would frequently describe a conventional approach.

Conventional is used when discussing methods, approaches, or ideas that have been accepted over time and have been adopted by the mainstream.

Different.wordDefinition:
Different means not the same as something else. For example, if someone has a different opinion than you, it means they don't agree with what you think.

Alternative is applicable when you have a choice to make whereas different is applicable when comparing two things.

Option.wordDefinition:
Option refers to a choice given between two or more things. It provides an opportunity to make a decision among a set of choices.

For example, a restaurant could offer several options for dinner entrees.

Alternative refers to one of the many options offered. It's another way to describe a choice that is different from the norm.

In simpler terms, option is the set of choices given while alternative is one of the choices offered.

Other.wordDefinition:
Alternative refers to a different option, while other refers to anything that is not the thing previously mentioned. For example, if you're asked what you want to eat for dinner and you suggest a vegetarian dish instead of meat, that's an alternative.

If you're asked what you want to do on Saturday night and you say "anything other than going to the movies," that's using "other."

Alternative tends to suggest a specific alternative option, while other can refer to any one of several possibilities.

Secondary.wordDefinition:
Secondary means something that is less important, or comes after the primary or main thing. For example, if you have a primary goal of studying hard to get good grades, then your secondary goal might be to play sports or hang out with friends.

Alternative refers to a different option, while secondary refers to something less important or that comes second to something else.

Substitute.wordDefinition:
Substitute means a replacement for something else. It implies that there is only one option, and the substitute is used when the original thing is not available or not preferred.

For example, if you don't have milk at home, you can use a substitute like almond milk.

So, in short, alternative means another choice, while a substitute means a replacement for something else.

quotes.Text: Love' is so short of perfect rhymes that convention allows half-rhymes like 'move.' The alternative is a plague of doves, or a kind of poem in which the poet addresses his adored both as 'love' and as 'guv' - a perfectly decent solution once, but only once, in a while.
quotes.Title: British Poet
quotes.Name: James Fenton

quotes.Text: An arts education helps build academic skills and increase academic performance, while also providing alternative opportunities to reward the skills of children who learn differently.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Gavin Newsom

quotes.Text: Perhaps anti-depressants should be best reserved for the very extreme cases and, more importantly, for those who do not respond to alternative forms of interventions.
quotes.Title: American Educator
quotes.Name: Irving Kirsch

quotes.Text: If insurance companies paid for lifestyle-management classes, they would save huge sums of money. We need to see that alternative medicine is now mainstream.
quotes.Title: American Speaker
quotes.Name: Deepak Chopra

quotes.Text: In part, slacktivism is what happens when the energy of otherwise dedicated activists is wasted on approaches that are less effective than the alternatives.
quotes.Title: Belarusian Writer
quotes.Name: Evgeny Morozov

quotes.Text: It's really been a long-term dream of mine to have an alternative to wood-based paper. Over half of the trees cut in the world are cut for paper products.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Woody Harrelson

quotes.Text: From my perspective, there's no reason to be afraid of aging, because if you age, you're lucky! The alternative is death.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Drew Barrymore

quotes.Text: When confronted with two alternatives, life and death, one is to choose death without hesitation.
quotes.Title: Japanese Soldier
quotes.Name: Yamamoto Tsunetomo

quotes.Text: We have always said that in our war with the Arabs we had a secret weapon - no alternative.
quotes.Title: Israeli Leader
quotes.Name: Golda Meir

quotes.Text: There is no alternative to peace. There is no sense to go to war.
quotes.Title: Israeli Statesman
quotes.Name: Shimon Peres
